CGI is a large class, providing several categories of methods, many of which are mixed in from other modules. trans-unit.source: Continuation objects are generated by Kernel#callcc, after having +require+d continuation. They hold a return address and execution context, allowing a nonlocal return to the end of the callcc block from anywhere within a program. Continuations are somewhat analogous to a structured version of C's setjmp/longjmp (although they contain more state, so you might consider them closer to threads).

Continuation objects are generated by Kernel#callcc, after having +require+d continuation. They hold a return address and execution context, allowing a nonlocal return to the end of the callcc block from anywhere within a program. Continuations are somewhat analogous to a structured version of C's setjmp/longjmp (although they contain more state, so you might consider them closer to threads).
trans-unit.target: Continuation 在具有+ require + d延续后，延续对象由 Kernel#callcc 生成。它们包含一个返回地址和执行上下文，从而允许从程序内的任何地方以非本地方式返回到 callcc 块的末尾。延续在某种程度上类似于C的 setjmp/longjmp 的结构化版本（尽管它们包含更多状态，因此您可能认为它们更接近线程）。

trans-unit.source: ERB (or Ruby code generated by ERB) returns a string in the same character encoding as the input string. When the input string has a magic comment, however, it returns a string in the encoding specified by the magic comment.

trans-unit.source: ERB is often used in .rhtml files (HTML with embedded Ruby). Notice the need in this example to provide a special binding when the template is run, so that the instance variables in the Product object can be resolved.
trans-unit.target: ERB 通常在 .rhtml 文件（带有嵌入式Ruby的HTML）中使用。注意，在此示例中，需要在运行模板时提供特殊的绑定，以便可以解析Product对象中的实例变量。

trans-unit.source: ERB is useful for any generic templating situation. Note that in this example, we use the convenient “% at start of line” tag, and we quote the template literally with %q{...} to avoid trouble with the backslash.
trans-unit.target: ERB 对于任何通用模板情况都是有用的。请注意，在此示例中，我们使用了方便的“％at line of start”标记，并且在字面上用 %q{...} 引用了模板，以避免反斜杠出现问题。

trans-unit.source: ERB provides an easy to use but powerful templating system for Ruby. Using ERB, actual Ruby code can be added to any plain text document for the purposes of generating document information details and/or flow control.
trans-unit.target: ERB 为Ruby提供了一个易于使用但功能强大的模板系统。使用 ERB ，可以将实际的Ruby代码添加到任何纯文本文档中，以生成文档信息详细信息和/或流程控制。

On a UDP-datagram socket this error indicates a previous send operation resulted in an ICMP Port Unreachable message.

trans-unit.source: read_nonblock just calls the read(2) system call. It causes all errors the read(2) system call causes: Errno::EWOULDBLOCK, Errno::EINTR, etc. The caller should care such errors.
trans-unit.target: read_nonblock 只是调用read（2）系统调用。它会导致read（2）系统调用引起的所有错误：Errno :: EWOULDBLOCK，Errno :: EINTR等。调用方应注意此类错误。

trans-unit.source: write_nonblock just calls the write(2) system call. It causes all errors the write(2) system call causes: Errno::EWOULDBLOCK, Errno::EINTR, etc. The result may also be smaller than string.length (partial write). The caller should care such errors and partial write.
trans-unit.target: write_nonblock 只是调用write（2）系统调用。它会导致write（2）系统调用导致的所有错误：Errno :: EWOULDBLOCK，Errno :: EINTR等。结果也可能小于string.length（部分写入）。调用者应注意此类错误和部分写入。

trans-unit.source: KDF is typically used for securely deriving arbitrary length symmetric keys to be used with an OpenSSL::Cipher from passwords. Another use case is for storing passwords: Due to the ability to tweak the effort of computation by increasing the iteration count, computation can be slowed down artificially in order to render possible attacks infeasible.
trans-unit.target: KDF 通常用于安全地从密码派生与 OpenSSL::Cipher 一起使用的任意长度的对称密钥。另一个用例是用于存储密码：由于能够通过增加迭代次数来调整计算工作量，因此可以人为地减慢计算速度，以使可能的攻击变得不可行。

trans-unit.source: PStore implements a file based persistence mechanism based on a Hash. User code can store hierarchies of Ruby objects (values) into the data store file by name (keys). An object hierarchy may be just a single object. User code may later read values back from the data store or even update data, as needed.
trans-unit.target: PStore 实现基于 Hash 的基于文件的持久性机制。用户代码可以按名称（键）将Ruby对象（值）的层次结构存储到数据存储文件中。对象层次结构可能只是一个对象。用户代码稍后可以根据需要从数据存储中读取值，甚至更新数据。

trans-unit.source: PStore objects are always reentrant. But if thread_safe is set to true, then it will become thread-safe at the cost of a minor performance hit.
trans-unit.target: PStore 对象始终是可重入的。但是，如果将 thread_safe设置为true，则它将变为线程安全的，但会降低性能。

trans-unit.source: Psych is a YAML parser and emitter. Psych leverages libyaml [Home page: pyyaml.org/wiki/LibYAML] or [HG repo: bitbucket.org/xi/libyaml] for its YAML parsing and emitting capabilities. In addition to wrapping libyaml, Psych also knows how to serialize and de-serialize most Ruby objects to and from the YAML format.
trans-unit.target: Psych 是YAML解析器和发射器。 Psych 利用libyaml [主页： pyyaml.org/wiki/LibYAML ]或[HG repo： bitbucket.org/xi/libyaml ]进行YAML解析和发出功能。除了包装libyaml外， Psych 还知道如何在大多数Ruby对象与YAML格式之间进行序列化和反序列化。

trans-unit.source: Psych provides a range of interfaces for parsing a YAML document ranging from low level to high level, depending on your parsing needs. At the lowest level, is an event based parser. Mid level is access to the raw YAML AST, and at the highest level is the ability to unmarshal YAML to Ruby objects.
trans-unit.target: Psych 提供了一系列用于解析YAML文档的接口，范围从低级到高级，具体取决于您的解析需求。在最低级别，是基于事件的解析器。中间级别是对原始YAML AST的访问，而最高级别是将YAML解组到Ruby对象的能力。

trans-unit.source: Psych provides a range of interfaces ranging from low to high level for producing YAML documents. Very similar to the YAML parsing interfaces, Psych provides at the lowest level, an event based system, mid-level is building a YAML AST, and the highest level is converting a Ruby object straight to a YAML document.
trans-unit.target: Psych 为生成YAML文档提供了从低到高的一系列接口。 Psych 与YAML解析接口非常相似， Psych在最低层提供基于事件的系统，中层在构建YAML AST，最高层在将Ruby对象直接转换为YAML文档。

trans-unit.source: Psych provides access to an AST produced from parsing a YAML document. This tree is built using the Psych::Parser and Psych::TreeBuilder. The AST can be examined and manipulated freely. Please see Psych::parse_stream, Psych::Nodes, and Psych::Nodes::Node for more information on dealing with YAML syntax trees.
trans-unit.target: Psych 提供对通过解析YAML文档生成的AST的访问。该树是使用 Psych::Parser 和 Psych::TreeBuilder 构建的。AST可以自由检查和操作。有关处理YAML语法树的更多信息，请参见 Psych::parse_stream ， Psych::Nodes 和 Psych::Nodes::Node 。

trans-unit.source: Random provides an interface to Ruby's pseudo-random number generator, or PRNG. The PRNG produces a deterministic sequence of bits which approximate true randomness. The sequence may be represented by integers, floats, or binary strings.
trans-unit.target: Random 提供了与Ruby的伪随机数生成器（PRNG）的接口。PRNG产生确定性的比特序列，近似于真正的随机性。该序列可以由整数，浮点数或二进制字符串表示。

trans-unit.source: Random.new will create a new PRNG with a state independent of Random::DEFAULT, allowing multiple generators with different seed values or sequence positions to exist simultaneously. Random objects can be marshaled, allowing sequences to be saved and resumed.
trans-unit.target: Random.new 将创建一个新的PRNG，其状态独立于 Random::DEFAULT ，从而允许同时存在具有不同种子值或序列位置的多个生成器。可以对 Random 对象进行编组，从而可以保存和恢复序列。

trans-unit.source: RMD160 calculates a digest of 160 bits (20 bytes).

trans-unit.source: RSA is an asymmetric public key algorithm that has been formalized in RFC 3447. It is in widespread use in public key infrastructures (PKI) where certificates (cf. OpenSSL::X509::Certificate) often are issued on the basis of a public/private RSA key pair. RSA is used in a wide field of applications such as secure (symmetric) key exchange, e.g. when establishing a secure TLS/SSL connection. It is also used in various digital signature schemes.
trans-unit.target: RSA 是一种非对称的公共密钥算法，已在RFC 3447中进行了形式化。它广泛用于公共密钥基础结构（PKI）中，在该基础结构中，证书（cf. OpenSSL::X509::Certificate ）通常是基于公共/私有 RSA 密钥对。 RSA 在诸如安全（对称）密钥交换之类的广泛应用中使用，例如在建立安全TLS / SSL连接时。它也用于各种数字签名方案中。

trans-unit.source: Syslog messages are typically passed to a central logging daemon. trans-unit.source: Time is an abstraction of dates and times. Time is stored internally as the number of seconds with fraction since the Epoch, January 1, 1970 00:00 UTC. Also see the library module Date. The Time class treats GMT (Greenwich Mean Time) and UTC (Coordinated Universal Time) as equivalent. GMT is the older way of referring to these baseline times but persists in the names of calls on POSIX systems.

trans-unit.source: TSort implements topological sorting using Tarjan's algorithm for strongly connected components.
trans-unit.target: TSort 使用Tarjan算法对强连接的组件实现拓扑排序。

trans-unit.source: TSort is designed to be able to be used with any object which can be interpreted as a directed graph.
trans-unit.target: TSort 设计为可以与任何可以解释为有向图的对象一起使用。

trans-unit.source: TSort requires two methods to interpret an object as a graph, tsort_each_node and tsort_each_child.
trans-unit.target: TSort 需要两种方法将对象解释为图形，即 tsort_each_node 和tsort_each_child。

trans-unit.source: each_strongly_connected_component returns nil.
trans-unit.target: each_strongly_connected_component 返回 nil 。

trans-unit.source: each_strongly_connected_component_from doesn't call tsort_each_node.
trans-unit.target: each_strongly_connected_component_from 不调用 tsort_each_node 。

trans-unit.source: tsort_each returns nil. If there is a cycle, TSort::Cyclic is raised.
trans-unit.target: tsort_each 返回 nil 。如果有一个循环，则 TSort::Cyclic 升高。

trans-unit.source: tsort_each_child is used to iterate for child nodes of node.
trans-unit.target: tsort_each_child 用于迭代 node的子节点。

trans-unit.source: tsort_each_child is used to iterate for child nodes of a given node.
trans-unit.target: tsort_each_child 用于迭代给定节点的子节点。

trans-unit.source: tsort_each_node is used to iterate for all nodes over a graph.
trans-unit.target: tsort_each_node 用于遍历图上的所有节点。

trans-unit.source: TupleBag is an unordered collection of tuples. It is the basis of Tuplespace.
trans-unit.target: TupleBag 是无序的元组集合。它是元组空间的基础。

trans-unit.source: TupleSpaceProxy allows a remote Tuplespace to appear as local.
trans-unit.target: TupleSpaceProxy 允许远程 Tuplespace显示为本地。

trans-unit.source: NO_FLUSH is the default flush method and allows deflate to decide how much data to accumulate before producing output in order to maximize compression.
trans-unit.target: NO_FLUSH 是默认的刷新方法，它允许deflate决定在生成输出之前要累积多少数据，以便最大程度地压缩。

trans-unit.source: Deflate compression strategy designed to be almost as fast as HUFFMAN_ONLY, but give better compression for PNG image data.
trans-unit.target: Deflate 压缩策略的设计速度几乎与 HUFFMAN_ONLY 一样快，但可以为PNG图像数据提供更好的压缩效果。

trans-unit.source: Deflate strategy for data produced by a filter (or predictor). The effect of FILTERED is to force more Huffman codes and less string matching; it is somewhat intermediate between DEFAULT_STRATEGY and HUFFMAN_ONLY. Filtered data consists mostly of small values with a somewhat random distribution.
trans-unit.target: Deflate 由过滤器（或预测器）产生的数据的策略。 FILTERED 的作用是强制使用更多的Huffman代码和较少的字符串匹配。它介于 DEFAULT_STRATEGY 和 HUFFMAN_ONLY 之间。过滤后的数据主要包含一些随机分布的小值。

trans-unit.source: Deflate strategy which prevents the use of dynamic Huffman codes, allowing for a simpler decoder for specialized applications.
trans-unit.target: Deflate 策略可防止使用动态霍夫曼码，从而为特殊应用提供了更简单的解码器。

trans-unit.source: Deflate strategy which uses Huffman codes only (no string matching).
trans-unit.target: Deflate 策略，仅使用霍夫曼码（不匹配字符串）。

trans-unit.source: Zlib::ZStream is the abstract class for the stream which handles the compressed data. The operations are defined in the subclasses: Zlib::Deflate for compression, and Zlib::Inflate for decompression.
trans-unit.target: Zlib::ZStream 是处理压缩数据的流的抽象类。这些操作在子类中定义： Zlib::Deflate 用于压缩， Zlib::Inflate 用于解压缩。

trans-unit.source: &., called “safe navigation operator”, allows to skip method call when receiver is nil. It returns nil and doesn't evaluate method's arguments if the call is skipped.
trans-unit.target: &. 称为“安全导航运算符”，允许在接收器为 nil 时跳过方法调用。如果调用被跳过，它将返回 nil ，并且不评估方法的参数。

trans-unit.source: (?!pat) - Negative lookahead assertion: ensures that the following characters do not match pat, but doesn't include those characters in the matched text
trans-unit.target: (?! pat ) - 否定超前断言：确保以下字符与pat不匹配，但在匹配的文本中不包括这些字符

trans-unit.source: (?<!pat) - Negative lookbehind assertion: ensures that the preceding characters do not match pat, but doesn't include those characters in the matched text
trans-unit.target: (?<! pat ) - 负向后断言：确保前面的字符不匹配pat，但不将那些字符包括在匹配的文本中

trans-unit.source: (?<=pat) - Positive lookbehind assertion: ensures that the preceding characters match pat, but doesn't include those characters in the matched text
trans-unit.target: (?<= pat ) - 正向隐式断言：确保前面的字符与pat匹配，但在匹配的文本中不包括这些字符

trans-unit.source: (?=pat) - Positive lookahead assertion: ensures that the following characters match pat, but doesn't include those characters in the matched text
trans-unit.target: (?= pat ) - 正向超前断言：确保以下字符与pat匹配，但在匹配的文本中不包括这些字符

trans-unit.source: =~ is Ruby's basic pattern-matching operator. When one operand is a regular expression and the other is a string then the regular expression is used as a pattern to match against the string. (This operator is equivalently defined by Regexp and String so the order of String and Regexp do not matter. Other classes may have different implementations of =~.) If a match is found, the operator returns index of first match in string, otherwise it returns nil.
trans-unit.target: =~ 是Ruby的基本模式匹配运算符。当一个操作数是正则表达式而另一个是字符串时，则将正则表达式用作与字符串匹配的模式。 （此运算符由 Regexp 和 String 等效地定义，因此 String 和 Regexp 的顺序无关紧要。其他类可能具有 =~ 不同实现。）如果找到匹配项，则该运算符将返回字符串中第一个匹配项的索引，否则返回返回 nil 。

trans-unit.source: =~ operator

trans-unit.source: ARGF is a stream designed for use in scripts that process files given as command-line arguments or passed in via STDIN.
trans-unit.target: ARGF 是一种流，旨在用于处理作为命令行参数或通过STDIN传递的文件的脚本中。

trans-unit.source: ARGF sets the line number automatically as you read data, so normally you will not need to set it explicitly. To access the current line number use ARGF.lineno.
trans-unit.target: ARGF 在读取数据时会自动设置行号，因此通常不需要显式设置它。要访问当前行号，请使用 ARGF.lineno 。

trans-unit.source: ARGF treats the files named on the command line as a single file created by concatenating their contents. After returning the last character of the first file, it returns the first character of the second file, and so on.
trans-unit.target: ARGF 将在命令行上命名的文件视为通过串联其内容创建的单个文件。返回第一个文件的最后一个字符后，它将返回第二个文件的第一个字符，依此类推。

trans-unit.source: BEGIN and END
trans-unit.target: BEGIN 和 END

trans-unit.source: BEGIN defines a block that is run before any other code in the current file. It is typically used in one-liners with ruby -e. Similarly END defines a block that is run after any other code.
trans-unit.target: BEGIN 定义一个块，该块在当前文件中的任何其他代码之前运行。它通常与 ruby -e 一起用于单线。同样， END 定义了一个在任何其他代码之后运行的块。

trans-unit.source: BEGIN must appear at top-level and END will issue a warning when you use it inside a method.
trans-unit.target: BEGIN 必须出现在顶层，当您在方法中使用它时， END 将发出警告。

trans-unit.source: Bundler.setup can be called only once, all subsequent calls are no-op.

trans-unit.source: Data input into an instance of Zlib::ZStream are temporally stored into the end of input buffer, and then data in input buffer are processed from the beginning of the buffer until no more output from the stream is produced (i.e. until avail_out > 0 after processing). During processing, output buffer is allocated and expanded automatically to hold all output data.
trans-unit.target: Data 输入到 Zlib::ZStream 实例的数据会暂时存储在输入缓冲区的末尾，然后从缓冲区的开头开始处理输入缓冲区中的数据，直到不再产生流的输出为止（即直到 avail_out > 0之后处理）。在处理期间，将自动分配并扩展输出缓冲区以容纳所有输出数据。

trans-unit.source: Data size limits vary between implementations. Original Berkeley DB was limited to 2GB of data. Dbm libraries also sometimes limit the total size of a key/value pair, and the total size of all the keys that hash to the same value. These limits can be as little as 512 bytes. That said, gdbm and recent versions of Berkeley DB do away with these limits.
trans-unit.target: Data 大小限制因实现而异。原始的Berkeley DB仅限2GB数据。dbm库有时还会限制键/值对的总大小以及散列为相同值的所有键的总大小。这些限制可以低至512字节。也就是说，gdbm和Berkeley DB的最新版本消除了这些限制。

trans-unit.target: Encoding::ASCII_8BIT 是一种特殊的编码，通常用于字节字符串，而不是字符串。但是，顾名思义，它在ASCII范围内的字符被视为ASCII字符。当您将ASCII-8BIT字符与其他ASCII兼容字符一起使用时，这很有用。

trans-unit.source: IO.select peeks the buffer of IO objects for testing readability. If the IO buffer is not empty, IO.select immediately notifies readability. This “peek” only happens for IO objects. It does not happen for IO-like objects such as OpenSSL::SSL::SSLSocket.
trans-unit.target: IO.select 会查看 IO 对象的缓冲区以测试可读性。如果 IO 缓冲区不为空，则 IO.select 会立即通知可读性。这种“偷看”仅发生在 IO 对象上。对于类似IO的对象（例如 OpenSSL::SSL::SSLSocket ，不会发生这种情况。

trans-unit.source: Symbol objects represent names and some strings inside the Ruby interpreter. They are generated using the :name and :"string" literals syntax, and by the various to_sym methods. The same Symbol object will be created for a given name or string for the duration of a program's execution, regardless of the context or meaning of that name. Thus if Fred is a constant in one context, a method in another, and a class in a third, the Symbol:Fred will be the same object in all three contexts.
trans-unit.target: Symbol 对象代表Ruby解释器中的名称和一些字符串。它们是使用 :name 和 :"string" 文字语法以及各种 to_sym 方法生成的。在程序执行期间，将为给定的名称或字符串创建相同的 Symbol 对象，而不管该名称的上下文或含义如何。因此，如果 Fred 在一个上下文中是一个常量，在另一个上下文中是一个方法，而在第三个上下文中是一个类，则 Symbol :Fred 将在所有三个上下文中都是相同的对象。

trans-unit.source: initheader are the default headers to use. Net::HTTP adds Accept-Encoding to enable compression of the response body unless Accept-Encoding or Range are supplied in initheader.
trans-unit.target: initheader 是要使用的默认头。 Net::HTTP 添加了Accept-Encoding以启用响应主体的压缩，除非 initheader 中提供了Accept-Encoding或 Range 。

trans-unit.source: initheader must be a Hash like { 'Accept' => '/', … }, and it defaults to an empty hash. If initheader doesn't have the key 'accept-encoding', then a value of “gzip;q=1.0,deflate;q=0.6,identity;q=0.3” is used, so that gzip compression is used in preference to deflate compression, which is used in preference to no compression. Ruby doesn't have libraries to support the compress (Lempel-Ziv) compression, so that is not supported. The intent of this is to reduce bandwidth by default. If this routine sets up compression, then it does the decompression also, removing the header as well to prevent confusion. Otherwise it leaves the body as it found it.
trans-unit.target: initheader 必须是一个 Hash 像{“接受” =>“ / ”，...}，并且默认为空的散列。如果 initheader 没有密钥“ accept-encoding”，则使用值“ gzip; q = 1.0，deflate; q = 0.6，identity; q = 0.3”，因此优先使用gzip压缩来压缩压缩，优先使用无压缩。 Ruby没有支持压缩（Lempel-Ziv）压缩的库，因此不支持该库。其目的是默认情况下减少带宽。如果此例程设置了压缩，那么它也会进行解压缩，同时也删除头文件以防止混淆。否则，它将离开找到的身体。
